intro: Guettarda monocarpa, commonly known as the scarlet guettarda, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of bright red, tubular flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Its flowers attract hummingbirds and other pollinators due to their nectar-rich structure. Guettarda monocarpa is often cultivated for its vibrant floral display and adaptability to warm, humid climates.
